review: First trip here as they have just opened and was very busy but got seated within 15 minutes at prime time for lunch. Grabbed a seat at the bar and was greeted promptly by the bartender who took our orders and was helpful and friendly. Menu is large with lots of selections for burgers, not a lot of low calorie options but some decent looking ones. My rating would be higher but this place suffers from the typical chain (Applebee, Chili's) approach that is ok to charge $13 for a Hamburger so expect a $15 or more lunch. Unfortunately Bloomington Normal has a quite competitive restaurant market and you can get as good or better burger/lunch for half the price at a number of places (Merna, Cheeks, Smashburger, Mugsys) so if your looking for value this is not the place. I had the Whiskey River BBQ chicken wrap and the flavor was good, a little much sauce made it uneatable towards the end of the wrap but really liked the smoky bbq flavor of the chicken. You get choice of fries or fruit and trying to be healthy I went with the fruit and that was a mistake as it was full of syrup like canned fruit not fresh tasting at all. Again for the prices they are charging here I expected more. So stick with the fries as I tasted my buddies and they were good steak fries a little undercooked but good tasting. The bartender and manager both asked how our meals were and took our feedback but like most chains they are powerless to do anything about menu prices or changing the fruit supplier. You can run over to Walmart and get a fresh fruit tray and serve that as a side and it would be much better :). So overall not a bad place to try and will eventually make it back to try different dishes but this is not going to be at the top of my list when trying to decide where to go for eats in the BloNo area.

This place is very pricey and not one I'd go to often. First off, I went with my sister and grandma. My sister got the Banzai burger, my grandma and I got the red robin gourmet burger.  My sister and grandma also ate the towering onion rings which were good! My grandma got the orange cream soda, me and my sister got the purple poppin lemonade. It was sweet and flavorful to the point we downed a few glasses of it.  As far as service went the server was awesome and requested refills for our fries and drinks right away. The only issue is our server was having an issue getting our checks split.    I'd have to say the price was the big killer for my review, not the food. Also, the wait time was another negative to this review as well. I get it's new and we did so on Father's Day weekend, but a 20 minute or so wait or longer had customers leave. We only stayed because we had a bit of time and wished to try it. All in all, I'd go when the hype dies down and if you have extra time along with extra money.

First visit to this location, and my first time at a Red Robin. I was not impressed. The host took our name when we arrived, but when it was time to seat us, she just kept saying "you guys" until we figured out she was talking to us.   Our server Landon, kept making trips to the table before taking a drink order. I think it was trip 3 or 4 he finally got to getting our order.  My order did not come as ordered, but nothing was done to correct it.  The fries that are supposedly endless took forever to get, and when we finally did get a refill there were about 10. The sweet potato fries were over cooked as well, and the menu doesn't illustrate that there was a price increase for substituting this option, nor did the server specify this.  The only part of the meal he was quick to handle was the check.
Best burger I've ever had but yes you're paying more for it. Service was good. Drinks were delicious.

Highly disappointed. First time at any Red Robin.  Service was awful - had to ask for silverware and napkins, had to ask for refills (which took around 15 minutes to get), only saw our server every 15 minutes.  Waited almost one hour for 2 burgers, chicken sandwich and salad.  My burger, the A1 Peppercorn, was subpar, not very flavorful, just so,so.  The other burger I was told was just ok.  The chicken sandwich was cold and chewy and only covered a small portion of the bun.  "Bottomless" fries = kids size fries (didn't even try and ask for more as I knew it would take a while).  A couple of employees were pretty impolite as well. And to top it off, a meal for 4 was $70 before the tip.  Doubt I will go back any time soon.

Mixed review on this place.  This is my second visit here.  First visit was the week they opened.  Everything ran like a charm the first time.  Several members of the corporate team checked on our experience.  It appears the corporate team is gone and they are flying solo.  The kitchen took too long to get our food out.  Perhaps it was because three members of the kitchen staff were in the bathroom checking their phones and chatting about sports.  The quality of the burgers was not to Red Robin standards.  My A1 peppercorn burger was made without some ingredients.  Our server Jackson quickly remedied this.  My dinner companion's Royal Red Robin burger had the runniest undercooked egg I've ever seen.  He just dealt with it.  The service is good.  Kitchen needs some work.  I'm certain this will be remedied as they are open longer.

Second visit warrants a review. First visit was on the 2nd weekday after opening and it was predictably WAY too crowded (like any new BloNo restaurant, which ought to tell people how starved we are for more options).  This visit was a lazy, late afternoon Sunday - not overly crowded in the bar. I say that, yet somehow, the staff (bar staff in particular) was still inexplicably 'too busy'. After watching a little closer they seem to put their barkeep in the middle of employee check-in, dessert-making, gossip, phone/carry-outs and a few tables in the bar, in addition to their more typical bartending duties. This means even when there are 3 or more of them behind the bar, there never seem to be enough?!  Which means those of us who like to dine at the bar are relegated to an after-thought.  And when you're an after-thought, bottomless anything doesn't seem so appealing, i.e. when it takes 10 minutes or more, to get another helping of whatever.  We like the decor, including the granite bar, the extensive menu and the bar TVs (altho 1 is apparently dedicated to infomercials!). But in addition to the disappointment in tap options (see my 'Tip', no real 'craft' here) and pricing (went with the $10 'tavern-style' thin double patties this time), the place can best be described as an over-priced burger joint where nothing really stands out, not even the burgers which I would describe as creative, overly saucy, and clearly over-priced.  After waiting another 10 mins to 'tab out', going forward we will opt for more efficiency, more tap choice and better value!

Very disappointing.  I have been to Red Robin restaurants in the Chicago area and they were great.  This restaurant is just sloppy in terms of food.  The server was really nice, but: * The burger wasn't cooked to order (they ask you how you want it cooked at Red Robin).  I asked for the burger to be cooked through, it was completely rare. * The milkshake had very little flavor. * The fries had definitely been under the heat lamp for a long time.  Don't bother with this restaurant- too many other good places to hit in town.

Wait times were a bit long for our food, but overall - not a bad experience. Burgers were great, although a bit pricey. Kids' portions were just right, not too much food, not too little. And they got balloons as they walked out.

Overhyped and way overpriced for a burger joint.  Tons of crazy burger selections, most of which the average consumer doesn't care about.  Wasn't impressed with the service. In a saturated market of burger type places, you have better options in BloNo.

We arrived at this location at 3:30 on Saturday. They weren't busy but after waiting for 30 min without a waitress coming by we decided to leave.  A manager was walking around & several waiters/waitresses in addition to the hostess that seated us.

I have visited this RR location twice now, both good experiences. I was in with co-workers yesterday and our waitress knew we were on lunch and did her best to get us in and out of there. I had the All American Patty Melt. I wouldn't call myself patty melt expert by any means - but this was one of the best I've ever had.  The first time I visited I had the Whiskey River Chicken Wrap. That was really good too. I had to force myself to try something different since their menu is full of items that look delicious. My only big complaint is that the appetizers are expensive - and small. So unless you really want an appetizer, I wouldn't spend the extra money. They get really busy at lunch - I suggest getting there on the early side - or on the later side. 11 or after 1:00.

The burgers are great.. I've tried two so far that were entirely different (the southern charm and banzai burger) and both flavorful.. the service was great even for how busy they were.. to the reviewer who waited a whole half hour to be greeted at a table: I commend your endurance but I would've politely flagged someone down much sooner :)

This location is way too small. Felt like I was eating in my car. No room on table or too walk between tables. The design was a very bad idea.  The food was ok but took too long for the app to arrive and a burger should not take as long as it did. I might go back but I don't think so.
Pretty expensive for burgers. I guess that's the point though. Very busy when we went, but I'm sure its calmed down now. Kinda small.

The wife and i went to this Red Robin other night.  It wasn't very busy, bt the service was still terrible.  We sat at the bar.  One bartender was more worried about cleaning the ice cream machine.  The other one had his attention on cleaning also.  It took over 30 mins to get our order.  The macaroni in my order was dry.  My wife's order was OK.  They didn't bring a side that asked for.  We had to ask for it.  They didn't bring napkins or silverware.  My order came with a spoon however a knife and fork would have been nice.  The wait staff didn't bother to ask if we needed anything.  They were too busy cleaning and talking to each other.  While we were eating, we got to listen to the pleasant sound of the ice cream machine going through it's cleaning cycle.  I started to get a bit ticked off that no one got us any silverware, I pushed my plate aside.  My wife got a hold of the manager and told her that the service was terrible.  Our waiter/bartender used the excuse that he thought the person who brought us our food brought silverware.  The manager took the food off of our bill.  All we had to pay for was the one beer that I had.  Not a good bar for sitting back and having a few.  The bar is small and the staff doesn't seem to know what should be on the TV's.  It was Thursday night and they didn't have the NFL game on.  We had to ask for them to turn it on and tell them what channel the game was on.  Also we got a $25 Red Robin gift card.  I think we are going to use  it in East Peoria.

Bottomless fries? Maybe if you stay for a couple hours.  I had one refill on fries and they took awhile to get there.  I had most of my burger eaten before they got there.  Overall the burger wasn't bad but it wasn't good either and for sure wasn't worth the price.  At least I can say I tried it once,

Worst service I have had at a red robin. I have been to the one in Peoria and its much better. We had burger which are over 10 bucks. And the bottomless fries never got refilled. And they weren't even busy. Waiter was rude and just wanted to get everybody in and out fast.
I've had much better burgers for half the price. Service is slow - the kitchen, not the waitstaff. Waitstaff is friendly and apologetic. Too bad. Won't go back after giving them a second chance.

This place is nothing to get excited about.  Went the other night for a burger. My wife and I ordered an entree salad and a $13 burger. Also got a couple beers. The food was all pretty average. The burger was the highlight, but at $13 it was a loss. The salad was just plain gross. It was called the spicy sombrero. It wasn't spicy. It was soggy, bland, and topped with a giant corn tortilla chip with some congealed cheese on it.  Moral of the story: I spent 45 dollars after a 20% tip to get some bar food that wasn't great.

I love this place. They have continually improved their food and the service is fab. This has been a pleasure coming here and I look forward to coming here even more!  I especially love their bottomless fries -- no junk, no fillers in them -- they are delicious!!

On 12/30/15 and 1/30/16, I called and placed a to go order. I waited the necessary time before going to pick up my food. The first visit, I waiting an additional 20-30 minutes before my food was ready and it was lukewarm. The second visit, the bar staff ignored me for a few minutes for helping me to pay for my order. He said my food wasn't ready yet and I waited an additional 20 minutes before he grabbed the bag a bag and said oh, here's your food. I was livid considering this was their second screw up with my food in one month. I spoke with a manager and my food was made fresh again with a refund. The issue I see is that unless you are drinking at the bar or dining in, you are not a priority and that is a serious problem. I now have gift cards from them, but quite honestly I am skeptical to go back to this location. They need to get it together and improve service.

Ordered red robin cheeseburger and banzai burgers. Berry limeade and blue moon wheat ale beer. The fries are bottomless (unlimited). Had the best burgers so far. Fresh, juicy, tasty. Fries are also great do not look oily at all.

We have been here several times, so I thought I would finally write a review.  The burgers are prepared per your specifications - our came back exactly as we ordered them every time.  The sweet potato fries are some of the best I have had.  It is definitely worth signing up for their rewards program - you get a free burger during your birthday month and other promos throughout the year.   On the downside, it is not cheap to eat here.  It can easily run $20+ for 2 people.  I never get a drink because I think $2.50 for soda is ridiculous.   The service we have received has always been good and now you can pay at your table (unless you are payments by cash) with the machine there.  You can also play unlimited games for $1.99.  Keeps the kids busy, I suppose.    Overall, the food is good, nice atmosphere....just not the cheapest.
Very Dirty!!  The tables are very close together.  The staff was not helpful.  Also, very difficult to get to the restaurant off Veterans Parkway.

There was a glitch during checkout, and the manager fixed it! I had a $20 voucher from the Red Robin Royalty program, but when I attempted to split the check, it applied the voucher to the wrong check, so I lost out on some of my voucher. The manager and wait staff were very friendly and accommodating at troubleshooting my problem and eventually comped the difference ($7) to ensure I got the full $20 off from the rewards program. It was very encouraging and pleasant. Food and drinks themselves were good--the cocktails were quite tasty (TNT and Patron Pear Martini) and the appetizers were a good size without being ridiculous. Service was absolutely brilliant this time around, but during my multiple visits it's always been good. As an ex-server, I have to hammer on quality service whenever I get it: these were very friendly people working in an obscenely busy restaurant and they made me feel welcome during Friday dinner rush. The manager fixing my checkout problem was just the cherry on top. Summary: decent/good food, tasty cocktails, amazing service.

Very overpriced for what you get: mediocre food. Having eaten at a corporate-owned Red Robin, in the past, this one does not come close to comparison. Also, the games are not free. Got to BWWs instead.

Manager was great, food took over 30 min and without having to ask our meal was free. Burgers tasted like they were microwaved though. Service was so slow and we got tired of waiting for the 2nd round of fries so we left. Red Robin is a great place to eat but you might need to give this location more time until they get the kinks worked out. They have great potential and good management.

The food is okay at best. We arrived and sat for over ten minutes before the server came by. I asked him why it took so long and he pointed at the tablet on the table and said we could've paged him. Really?!? Then the food took 45 minutes for 3 burgers and a chicken sandwich. I'll never return, ever!

Well, ANOTHER BloNo restaurant with no sense of urgency.  Went in with my daughters hoping to grab a quick meal.  We were seated promptly enough, but 'Elsa,' whose section we were seated in, never arrived.  I even used the table-top device to call a server, but nobody seemed interested in responding to the flashing red light.   I swear, I'm not a problem customer, nor a high-maintenance pain in the ass. But I have ZERO tolerance for slackers in the service industry. Maybe my expectations are too high, having moved here fron north of I-80. As we were leaving, I saw a uniformed waitress getting out of a car. Was this the elusive Elsa? I guess we'll never know...

The food here is so good. A little pricey fora burger, but well worth it. This time I just stopped in for something light - $3 wedge salad and garlic herb fries. Both were amazing. And the customer service is great too. My server, Derreck was very friendly and checked on me often.

Great experience with take out. Tom the bartender took my order over the phone and was so nice to me when i got there. When I got my food to the hotel it was fresh, the order was accurate, and he gave me plenty of ketchup and utensils. Tom rocks!!

So, Red Robin in Bloomington has a lot of competition...and I am not so sure they care. We waited at the hostess stand for 6 minutes while the phone rang off the hook....and 1/2 of the restaurant was completely empty. Seated and waited nearly 10 minutes for a waiter. Ordered and waited over 25 minutes for food. All of which is fine- short staffed, people called in....whatever. The food.  My burger was luke warm and darn near burnt.  My husband's fries were the bottom of the basket soggy messes. Manager came by- asked how meal was...said "ok" and he walked....my husband flagged him down and explained our experience...Manager's response was thanks for letting me know...which, is an acknowledgement. I am not a huge chain fan and this one is an expensive one, and just not good.  Not good at all.

Pleasant ambience with good burgers and bottomless fries. I always go with the onion rings as an appetizer. Royal Burger (fried egg) is your best bet for burgers if you want to take the experience to the next level.

I realize how basic I am for saying this but I actually really like Red Robin! Not sure about why there are so many negative reviews but I had a good experience here. I usually get clucks and fries but opted for a burger and was pretty pleased with my selection. By no means was it the best burger I've had, but it was still a solid meal. I'd stick with the gourmet burgers not go near the regular cheaper ones. Also I love the bottomless fries especially with the honey mustard they have! Over all a pretty great meal! The service was also very friendly and helpful. I just wish they hadn't seated us near a bunch of families with kids.

I have a very bad habit which is "eating out." My daughter and I go back and fourth regarding where we should eat. She prefers I cook but that's not an option but it really needs to become one. I thought well let's go to Red Robin after finding out about the burger special. As I pull into the parking lot I see two employees out back smoking. We walk into Red Robin's and there's a line of people waiting to be acknowledged & seated. We're all standing there for a few minutes then someone finally pops up at to greet us....it's the guy that was out back smoking a cigarette. He looked as if he could have been a manager. So there's people waiting and you're out back smoking a cigarette. I can't judge the food because I decided that we'll have a burger @ chili's once I took a closer look @ the guy who came in from smoking to greet us...let's just say I'm not sure if he was really smoking cigarettes. He just had an odd look...maybe he was tired. I felt more comfortable going elsewhere. I enjoyed my meal @ Chili's. Also the server Tish was awesome. I excellent customer service
The burgers are good, and my wife likes the food. Some of the food is a little messy and drips sauce all over.

Third time I have ate at this Red Robin and it was no better than the last 2!  Busy on cinco de mayo so I understand the slower service but the waiter did not know types of margaritas.  Towards the end of our meal he asked if I wanted more fries and I said sure. He came back 15 minutes later with a check and said we could pay him with cash or pay with card at the table. I asked about the fries and bam out came the hottest food of the night.

The quality of the food is okay.  But they totally misrepresent the portion sizes of the hamburgers.  They are a LOT smaller than I'd expect from the menu description and the price.  A $10 burger should be better and bigger than what they give you at this place.  Seriously...the "pig out" version of the burger I got was no bigger than a Mcdonald's quarter pounder and only came with 3 pieces of bacon.   Red Robbin isn't the trendy place it used to be either.  It's morphed into a Applebee's like clone, complete with the feel of the Office Space "Flingers" joint.  I did not feel like wearing ANY pieces of flair here and clearly neither did the waitress who rolled her eyes when I complained about the size of my burger.

Just another burger at burger avenue a.k.a college avenue. The burgers are ok, but highly overpriced. We got the unlimited fries, but the waitress only brought us two orders, don't waste your money, you won't get more than a couple of helpings.  Better and cheaper burgers on the same street, lol.

The burgers are good but unless you get the tavern ones they are WAY over priced.  Also the endless fries are only as good as they have them ready.  Our one re-order took like 8 or 9 minutes.  I guess that is one way to control how many the customers get.  We had an odd issue with gnats or fruit flies at our table as well.  I killed probably 4 of them.  The final kick in the pants is the crappy pay at the table kiosks.  Those damned things NEVER print a receipt so the server had to go get it.  Just frigging take my card and run it for me!  A sit down restaurant that is self serve to pay.  Total BS.  Guess I don't need to tip as much if I have to run my own card.  I doubt I'll be back much which is too bad.  It's only three blocks from our office.  For me, you can keep your over priced burgers, crappy payment machines, and your fruit flies. Wow why the hell do I keep coming back to this place? Overpriced and you can't get a pen to sign your damn credit card receipt because they want you to use the stupid kiosks at the table that never work.

I always enjoy my visit at Red Robin! This time I had the A1 Peppercorn, my favorite. The service could have been a bit quicker, but we were visiting with family so it didn't bother us. We also had the Fourth of July themed ice cream cake which was excellent! Will certainly return!!

$20+ is entirely too much for a slightly above average burger and fries. The endless steak fries are nice, but doesn't justify the price. I also moved the game screen and accidentally hit a button. That cost me $2 because the button was for a "premium" game. You know....like the ones for free most phones have. They were busy so I just paid it and left. Do away with that gimmick. Make your burgers worthy of the price tag. Until then, I won't be back.

I will state: I went into the location to purchase a gift card. I waited at the reception desk while three hostesses look "deer in headlights" over a family of six. One of which had absolutely no idea what planet she was on.  I went to the bar so I could purchase the gift card. As I arrived, I noticed a "to go order" customer standing so I asked how long she'd been there .... Red Robin "lost" her order. It was never entered into the computer I'm assuming.  The manager was prompt with helping her.  The bartender acknowledged me. Yet she continued to pour drink tickets. Stood there for another 5 minutes. Thanks to the manager who finally asked me if I'd been helped. ...that's when I finally was able to get my purchase completed.  If the service is this shitty for a gift card, I'll avoid wasting my time for a sit down.

I'm going to preface this review by coming out. I have a condition, I'm a freckled lemonade addict. The addiction started back when I was a toddler. Once I had that sweet sweet nectar I was an addict for life. I unfortunately don't come to Red Robin much anymore because my fiancé doesn't care for them much. I on the other hand couldn't love anywhere else more. I came here today with my work team and got the Hawaiian Burger with onion rings as a side. The Good -Service is usually great. Always attentive and never make me feel like I'm an inconvenience. -In my opinion their onion rings are some of the best out there, bar none. No one else has breading like theirs. -BOTTOMLESS SIDES. Almost all of their sides are bottomless, so bring your appetite. -Their sauces are pretty good! -They have a low carb options for all their sandwiches! -Freckled lemonade!! They even have a lo cal version. -Great fries! The Not So Good -They put BBQ sauce on the bottom of my burger which made it get soggy pretty quickly and messy. -Prices are not the best. If you want one of their better burgers it's $13-$15. -Their burgers are okay, but nothing to write home about. I grew up being a Red Robin kid, I'll always love them. They have a ton of options which allows even the pickiest of eaters to eat there.While they have some areas to improve in, they have a lot of things going for them that make them unique and a great place to eat!
The service is horrible. The management is incompetent. The food is acceptable IF you ever get your order. Not worth the aggravation. Should be able to give them negative stars
